page.title: 04FARLOW CofE Cont.PRIMARY SCH
page.content: Farlow Church of England (Controlled) Primary School has 61 children in three classes taught by three full time teachers including the Headteacher who teaches the Upper Junior class. The main building, built in the 1850's, houses the infant class and the Lower Junior class. The Upper Junior class is housed in a second hand portable classroom, which has been at Farlow for 14 years. The Domesday Survey work has been done on our BBC computer which was provided by the Parent Teacher Association. We also have "My Talking Computer" and "Big trac" computer education equipment. There are 16 children in the lower junior class, 17 children in the infant class and 28 children in the upper junior class.
